alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 8:22PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN SCHLEICHER...EAST CENTRAL CROCKETT AND SUTTON COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 822 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of I-10 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line, or 16 miles west of Sonora, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Sonora, I-10 Near The Crockett- Sutton County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Ranch Road 1989, Us- 277 Near The Sutton- Schleicher County Line, and The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 371 and 425. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
